com.oregonscientific.meep.util
Class ImageCache

java.lang.Object
  com.oregonscientific.meep.util.ImageCache

public class ImageCache
extends Object

Adapted from the Android Developer source code, can be found in: http://developer.android.com/shareables/training/BitmapFun.zip This class holds bitmap caches (memory and disk).

Nested Class Summary
static class ImageCache.ImageCacheParams
          A holder class that contains cache parameters.
static class ImageCache.RetainFragment
          A simple non-UI Fragment that stores a single Object and is retained over configuration changes.

ImageCache

public ImageCache(ImageCache.ImageCacheParams cacheParams)
Creating a new ImageCache object using the specified parameters.

Parameters:
cacheParams - The cache parameters to use to initialize the cache

ImageCache

public ImageCache(Context context,
                  String uniqueName)
Creating a new ImageCache object using the default parameters.

Parameters:
context - The context to use
uniqueName - A unique name that will be appended to the cache directory
Method Detail

findOrCreateCache

public static ImageCache findOrCreateCache(FragmentManager fragmentManager,
                                           ImageCache.ImageCacheParams cacheParams)
Find and return an existing ImageCache stored in a ImageCache.RetainFragment, if not found a new one is created using the supplied params and saved to a ImageCache.RetainFragment.

Parameters:
fragmentManager - The fragment manager to use when dealing with the retained fragment.
cacheParams - The cache parameters to use if creating the ImageCache
Returns:
An existing retained ImageCache object or a new one if one did not exist

initDiskCache

public void initDiskCache()
Initializes the disk cache. Note that this includes disk access so this should not be executed on the main/UI thread. By default an ImageCache does not initialize the disk cache when it is created, instead you should call initDiskCache() to initialize it on a background thread.

addBitmapToCache

public void addBitmapToCache(String data,
                             Bitmap bitmap)
Adds a bitmap to both memory and disk cache.

Parameters:
data - Unique identifier for the bitmap to store
bitmap - The bitmap to store

getBitmapFromMemCache

public Bitmap getBitmapFromMemCache(String data)
Get from memory cache.

Parameters:
data - Unique identifier for which item to get
Returns:
The bitmap if found in cache, null otherwise

getBitmapFromDiskCache

public Bitmap getBitmapFromDiskCache(String data,
                                     int maxWidth,
                                     int maxHeight)
Get from disk cache.

Parameters:
data - Unique identifier for which item to get
Returns:
The bitmap if found in cache, null otherwise

clearCache

public void clearCache()
Clears both the memory and disk cache associated with this ImageCache object. Note that this includes disk access so this should not be executed on the main/UI thread.

flush

public void flush()
Flushes the disk cache associated with this ImageCache object. Note that this includes disk access so this should not be executed on the main/UI thread.

close

public void close()
Closes the disk cache associated with this ImageCache object. Note that this includes disk access so this should not be executed on the main/UI thread.

getDiskCacheDir

public static File getDiskCacheDir(Context context,
                                   String uniqueName)
Get a usable cache directory (external if available, internal otherwise).

Parameters:
context - The context to use
uniqueName - A unique directory name to append to the cache dir
Returns:
The cache dir

hashKeyForDisk

public static String hashKeyForDisk(String key)
A hashing method that changes a string (like a URL) into a hash suitable for using as a disk filename.

Parameters:

Returns:
size in bytes

isExternalStorageRemovable

public static boolean isExternalStorageRemovable()
Check if external storage is built-in or removable.

Returns:
True if external storage is removable (like an SD card), false otherwise.

Check how much usable space is available at a given path.

Parameters:

Returns:

Locate an existing instance of this Fragment or if not found, create and add it using FragmentManager.

Parameters:

Returns:
The existing instance of the Fragment or the new instance if just created.
